title: Sopronbánfalva
text: Sopronbánfalva (), also known as Bánfalva, is a former <a href="village">village</a> part of the <a href="city">city</a> of <a href="Sopron">Sopron</a>, <a href="Hungary">Hungary</a>, since 1950. Before 1945, the village had 3,304 inhabitants, with the majority being ethnic <a href="Germans">Germans</a>. However, many <a href="Flight%20and%20expulsion%20of%20Germans%20%281944%E2%80%931950%29%23Hungary">were deported</a>, remaining only approximately 700 inhabitants after the event. This happened due to the desire to, among other things, secure the border with <a href="Austria">Austria</a>.
